title: Marijuana Extraction: A Personal History & Technical Overview
author: Angelicalist (Van Kush Family)
source: Personal experience from McKinney TX through Colorado era to modern distillate
overview: Evolution of cannabis extraction from simple acetone pulls to modern distillation, covering bubble hash, BHO, CO2, and hemp-derived cannabinoids

applications: Reapplied to plant material to increase potency

butter_extraction.evolution: Later switched to oil - found it to be better

colorado_era.context: After leaving Texas, traveling through California, Florida, Mexico, New Mexico

equipment: Mirror or glass table for collection
dry_ice_extraction.process: Shake bubble bag with ground marijuana, dry ice causes trichomes to fall through silk screen microns

matt_rize_ice_tek.status: Top of the line at the time

dangers.incidents: People setting themselves on fire, blowing up houses
dangers.cause: Indoor BHO extractions with improper ventilation

mechanisms_of_potentiation.bbb_opening: Opens Blood-Brain Barrier allowing more THC to reach receptors
mechanisms_of_potentiation.cyp450_inhibition: Blocks CYP450 enzymes that break down THC
mechanisms_of_potentiation.alpha2_adrenergic: Activates alpha-2 adrenergic receptors (sedation, lower BP, slower HR)

route_dependent_effects.inhaled_thc: INCREASED potency - CYP inhibition slows metabolism
route_dependent_effects.edible_thc: POTENTIALLY DECREASED - blocks conversion to active 11-OH-THC metabolite
route_dependent_effects.note: This is why smoking with myrcene feels stronger but edibles may be weaker

mango_myth.claim: Eating mango before cannabis increases effects
mango_myth.reality: Mangoes contain insufficient myrcene quantities to meaningfully affect potency

myrcene_research.commercial_applications: Mango-flavored marijuana vapes capitalize on perceived synergy

personal_observation.result: Substance separated on bottom - assumed to be myrcene

toxicity_paradox.toxic_doses: Myrcene shows toxic effects at doses humans don't normally encounter
toxicity_paradox.protective_effect: Blocks CYP enzymes that activate carcinogens and aflatoxin B

folk_remedy.claim: Eating black pepper helps bad marijuana effects
folk_remedy.mechanism: CB2 receptor agonist, may modulate THC-induced anxiety

research_sources: Frontiers in Pharmacology 2025 - Cannabinoids and CYP450 review

classic_solvent_extraction.era: 1940s-1970s established, remained gold standard for decades
process: Use separatory funnel to isolate layers
Vacuum purge to remove residual solvents
classic_solvent_extraction.reference: Dr. Atomic's Marijuana Multiplier - goldmine of information

limitations.issue: Lot left in vape cartridge that couldn't be used
limitations.viscosity: Required cutting agents or had poor wicking

thcp.name: THCp (Tetrahydrocannabiphorol)
thcp.binding: Longer alkyl side chain = stronger CB1 binding

hemp_derived_cannabinoids.production: Most converted from CBD isolate through isomerization

cyp450_cannabis_connections.relevance: Connects to Oilahuasca knowledge base - same CYP450 enzyme manipulation principles

metabolites.11_oh_thc: 11-hydroxy-THC - ACTIVE, more potent than THC itself
metabolites.thc_cooh: THC-COOH - INACTIVE, what drug tests detect

thc_cyp_inhibition.implication: THC can affect metabolism of other drugs

cbd_cyp_interactions.drug_interactions: CBD significantly affects levels of medications metabolized by these enzymes

cbn_interactions.note: CBN (oxidized THC) also affects drug metabolism

myrcene.effect_smoked: Increases potency by slowing THC breakdown
myrcene.effect_edibles: May DECREASE potency by blocking 11-OH-THC formation

terpene_enzyme_interactions.limonene: CYP inducer - may speed metabolism (found in citrus, cannabis)
terpene_enzyme_interactions.monoterpenoids: 2025 research: α-pinene, limonene directly activate CB1 receptor

mango_method.reality: Likely insufficient myrcene in mango to matter

potentiation_strategies.grapefruit: CYP3A4 inhibitor - may increase THC duration and intensity
potentiation_strategies.black_pepper: Beta-caryophyllene for anxiety reduction via CB2

oilahuasca_parallel.shared_principle: Both systems use CYP450 manipulation to alter drug effects
oilahuasca_parallel.difference: Oilahuasca: INDUCE then INHIBIT CYP1A2 | Cannabis: mostly INHIBIT CYP2C9/3A4
oilahuasca_parallel.terpene_role: Terpenes in both systems modulate enzyme activity

yangonin_research.implication: May synergize with or modulate cannabis effects

combination_effects.reported: Enhanced relaxation, different character than either alone
combination_effects.caution: Both affect CYP enzymes - potential for interactions

dr_atomic_marijuana_multiplier.title: Dr. Atomic's Marijuana Multiplier
dr_atomic_marijuana_multiplier.historical_significance: Foundational text for DIY cannabis extraction
dr_atomic_marijuana_multiplier.note: Goldmine of information for extraction techniques

bho_warnings: Butane is heavier than air - pools on floor
Many deaths and injuries from indoor BHO
solvent_safety: Full vacuum purge required for consumable products
safety_notes.legal_considerations: Laws vary by jurisdiction - research local regulations
